name: Hampton Inn and Suites Seattle-Airport/28th Ave

reviews.text: Drove down from Vancouver, BC for a Seattle shopping trip prior to the Labor Day weekend. We stayed 4 days at this Hampton Inn and we were not disappointed. We felt right at home as soon as we arrived. Clean and comfortable room, newer fitness equipment, and gratifying breakfasts at an affordable price. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Seattle.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.text: New hotel, we had a king suite which was very roomy and very clean. Staff is super helpful. The breakfast is restaurant quality with different items every day. Pool is very nice and the business center is well equipped. The shuttle will take you to restaurants and the light rail besides the usual stops. Parking is underground (keeps the vehicle protected). No complaints.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: I booked this via a discount website for Labor Day weekend in Seattle. Even though it's not close to downtown, they have a free shuttle that drops you off at the Lightrail station. For $2.50, you can get yourself downtown and not have to pay for parking! The staff was super friendly, the room was quite large (we had a king), nice TV, fantastic bed and linens and all was really, really clean! The breakfast area is quite large and a nice variety of hot and cold items. All around, I'm really happy with our stay here!
reviews.title: Great new hotel

reviews.text: Nice new hotel with comfortable room. It did say we were to have a microwave/fridge which we did not in our room but did exceed expectations and priced great! Worth it for a quick stopover- couple of minutes to airport
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: High quality Hampton standards. Good jumping off point minutes to airport. Would stay again waiting for plane. Good breakfast. Did not use shuttle but others looked contint. No major plane noise from room.
reviews.title: Standard Hampton Quailty with Airport shuttle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now you may think that makes it a noisy place but you'd be wrong....
reviews.title: Nice new hotel that you can see from your aircraft at take off!

reviews.text: We stayed here 4 nights at the end of August. We had a junior suite for which we paid an average of $150pn (plus tax) As others have noted this is a new hotel (as yet just an unused parking lot if you want to look at it on google street maps) We had quite a long wait for the shuttle which was explained away as "heavy traffic". But it only took about 5 minutes to arrive once we were picked up (international terminal). Check in was fast and courteous. High speed internet access and parking are both free as is the breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice looking rooms but bad air quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large with a sitting area and large bed separated by a desk and TV. All the upholstery is obviously new - you could sort of smell it but it honestly wasn't bad (certainly didn't make us ill) Air con certainly worked well. The bed was superb - firm but comfortable and we both slept soundly. The blackout curtains did their job too - very little light to disturb you. Bathroom was spotlessly clean - note that the sink and vanity area is located outside the room containing the bath and WC. Lots of storage/wardrobe space available if you want to unpack rather than live out of your suitcases.
reviews.title: Hard to Beat !

reviews.text: Had mixed feelings about breakfast - the eggs and bacon/ham was nice but the "biscuits with gravy" on the weekend wasn't pleasant. Also the fresh fruit disappeared at the weekend which was a shame. They also ran out of green tea on Saturday and it hadn't been replenished by Sunday which was disappointing. Breakfast area was also busy around 9.00am at the weekends so I recommend you go earlier if you prefer some quiet whilst eating...
reviews.title: Spacious, clean, and comfortable

reviews.text: The hotel was definitely very busy at the weekend - quieter during the week. I thought it was a great place for anyone on a business trip as overall the accommodations and service were on par with the Hilton down the road (in fact I preferred this hotel over the "full service" Hilton due to the quality of the rooms and bathrooms)
reviews.title: What a superb hotel! Diamond got a free upgrade to Suite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a nice 2-night stay at this new Hampton Inn at the tail end of a Seattle area trip. It's very convenient to the airport as well as to Hwy 99 and the interstate.
reviews.title: New location Hampton Inn

reviews.text: While all Hampton Inns are very similar (intentionally), the actual execution and atmosphere can vary. This location is exemplary, doing exactly what Hampton Inn should do and doing it well-- friendly, straightforward, clean, minimal frills but reasonable quality. For the price range, it's very decent. And it's a predictably good value.
reviews.title: Wonerful hotel close to Seatac!

reviews.text: This Hampton is larger than most of the 6 (or so) others I've stayed in, with long hallways, a large conference area on the ground floor, a small above-ground parking area, and a larger garage under the building.
reviews.title: New hotel convenient to airport

reviews.text: We considered staying at the nearby Doubletree (another Hilton property) but that one charges for parking and was older. This new Hampton Inn is just south of the Sea-Tac airport (confusingly on the same road as an older location that is the "Airport" Hampton Inn).
reviews.title: Don't confuse the Hampton Inns!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I asked for a room on the back of the hotel (and prefer a high floor), so we had a 4th floor overlooking the parking lot and a motel behind the Hampton. Not very scenic, but with the building between us and the airport and nearby roads, it was very quiet despite the relative proximity of the runway.
reviews.title: Choose THIS Hampton-there are 3 at SEATAC

reviews.text: Were here just overnight waiting to fly home. Very comfortable beds. Didn't eat the breakfast because we had an early flight, but there were lots of people partaking. Great price compared to the Hilton we stayed at before, but not the amenities, of course.
reviews.title: Very new and very clean

reviews.text: There are a few Hanmptons and many other Hiltons in Seattle area- all are much higher; many charge for wireless; most charge for parking; some do not have breakfast. Thiis 2 month old (Aug 2012) new Hampton has it all for free and we got a huge room for $152. The kids had huge space to spread out. The reception staff was cheerful and helpful for our 3 days. The breakfast team was really friendly and responsive. Pool was nice but lacks hot tub. Fitness room was really nice. This is extremnely close to the airport but our room (on far side) had no flight noise.
reviews.title: New Hampton and we loved it

reviews.text: Hotel was great about letting us check in early but service was lacking. The desk staff were not that friendly or informative, although the shuttle drivers were.
reviews.title: good, but not great

reviews.text: The room was ok.
reviews.title: Best Hampton Inn I've stayed at yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shuttle provided by Seattle business bureau was nice but I only knew about it because I overheard someone talking about it. Breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Sleeping well in Seattle
